title: Kurds say 785 Isis affiliates have escaped camp after Turkish shelling
text:
The Kurdish-led administration in northern Syria said 785 foreign individuals affiliated with the Islamic State have escaped the camp where they were being held following heavy Turkish shelling.

In an apparent reference to Turkish-backed Syrian insurgents, the Kurds said that mercenaries had attacked the camp where Daesh – as Isis is also known – “elements” attacked camp guards and opened the gates.

“The brutal military assault led by Turkey and its mercenaries is now taking place near a camp in Ain Issa, where there are thousands (of people) from families of Isis,” the Kurds said, adding “some were able to escape after bombardments that targeted” the camp.

More to follow …
description: Kurdish-led administration in northern Syria says mercenaries attacked camp and opened gates to release captives
